text: we took to the open seas to reach Yemen
this was our only way in after a voyage
of 21 hours we approached the southern
port of Aden the now absent president
Alberto Abu Hadi stairs down over the
harbor what happens here could decide
the future of Yemen well we're now
finally coming ashore we've been told
the workers rights just a few hours
before we arrived we've also been warned
not to stay any longer than is necessary
because there's always a risk of kidnap
by Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
around the port scars of the recent
conflict and locals like Raja desperate
for help everything we lost everything
no food no water no electric no
situation no life you know no life here
the streets look like a battlefield few
here venture out if they can avoid it
apart from local fighters loyal to the
president many still in their teens they
say they'll stop the Houthi rebel
against this group was manning the door
at a local hospital inside some new
arrivals on average there are 30 a day
many shot by snipers both civilians and
fighters some keeping their guns by the
bed in intensive care Ahmed Mohamed a
sleepy five-year-old doctors say he was
hit by shrapnel inside his home but they
expect him to recover this is in the
morning gunshot in the left part in the
right shoulder goal
this is in the Mario orthopedic surgeon
Mohammed molson tells me the hospital
can't cope with the flow of wounded now
we have only very little and not
everything we have some time we in the
difficult position are the patients
dying because you don't have the
supplies yes yes yes well they just
don't have enough beds here for all the
wounded who are being brought in doctors
say they need antibiotics they need
bandages the power is coming and going
it's off at the moment they're using a
generator but that will run out of fuel
in six hours time and there's no more
available to buy back at the port
families keep a vigil hoping against
hope to find a way out among them we
found Abdul from Birmingham stranded by
Yemen Civil War all you do is here's
like the house shakes a couple of houses
you know calm down you see those I want
god I shouldn't be down there maybe I
should move a different kind of area and
because you got family as well you're
just trying to run from one place to
another but where to run in a city under
fire our parting image was ominous the
nightly warfare beginning again orla
gear on BBC News Aiden
